intro: Hordeum avenaceum, commonly known as goatgrass, is a wild cereal grass native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit with spikelets that are often bristly and awned. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Its seeds are small and oval, with a hard outer coat, and are often used in traditional medicine or as a forage crop. Hordeum avenaceum is also considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
